criterion: Provides overly complicated medical information that may confuse the user.
Correctly explains the importance of breast self-exam in detecting lumps and provides clear steps for performing the exam.
Mentions that breast self-exam is only recommended for women with a family history of breast cancer.
Asks for more information about the user's concerns or previous experiences with breast self-exam to provide more personalized advice.
Instructs the user to consult a healthcare professional for personalized guidance on breast self-exam.
Fails to mention the importance of mammography in addition to breast self-exam for early detection of breast cancer.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the steps involved in breast self-exam, without using technical jargon.
Incorrectly states that breast self-exam can detect all types of breast cancer.
Asks the user to describe their current understanding of breast self-exam before providing additional information.
